segment.source: DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: The international commands can be used to change international settings in Windows and Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) images.
segment.target: The international commands can be used to change international settings in Windows and Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) images.

segment.source: You can also query existing settings in an offline or online Windows image.
segment.target: You can also query existing settings in an offline or online Windows image.

segment.source: The base syntax for servicing a Windows image using the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) tool is:
segment.target: The base syntax for servicing a Windows image using the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) tool is:

segment.source: There are three types of international servicing commands:
segment.target: There are three types of international servicing commands:

segment.source: Retrieves a report of the international settings for an offline image or a running operating system.
segment.target: Retrieves a report of the international settings for an offline image or a running operating system.

segment.source: Sets the different international settings for an offline image.
segment.target: Sets the different international settings for an offline image.

segment.source: Generates the Lang.ini file that is used during Setup.
segment.target: Generates the Lang.ini file that is used during Setup.

segment.source: The following international servicing options are available for an offline image:
segment.target: The following international servicing options are available for an offline image:

segment.source: The following international servicing options are available for a running operating system:
segment.target: The following international servicing options are available for a running operating system:

segment.source: The following table provides a description of how each international servicing option can be used.
segment.target: The following table provides a description of how each international servicing option can be used.

segment.source: When used immediately after an international servicing command-line option, information about the option and the arguments is displayed.
segment.target: When used immediately after an international servicing command-line option, information about the option and the arguments is displayed.

segment.source: Additional topics might become available when an image is specified.
segment.target: Additional topics might become available when an image is specified.

segment.source: Displays information about international settings and languages.
segment.target: Displays information about international settings and languages.

segment.source: Use the /Online option to display information about international settings and languages in the running operating system.
segment.target: Use the /Online option to display information about international settings and languages in the running operating system.

segment.source: Use the /Image:path_to_offline_image_directory option to display information about international settings and languages in the offline image.
segment.target: Use the /Image:path_to_offline_image_directory option to display information about international settings and languages in the offline image.

segment.source: When used with the /Distribution options, information about international settings and languages in the distribution is displayed.
segment.target: When used with the /Distribution options, information about international settings and languages in the distribution is displayed.

segment.source: The name of the folder in the distribution share is not validated.
segment.target: The name of the folder in the distribution share is not validated.

segment.source: Where locale_name is the name of the folder.
segment.target: Where locale_name is the name of the folder.

segment.source: The user locale is reported only for offline images.
segment.target: The user locale is reported only for offline images.

segment.source: The report does not include this setting for running operating systems.
segment.target: The report does not include this setting for running operating systems.

segment.source: Sets the default system user interface (UI) language.
segment.target: Sets the default system user interface (UI) language.

segment.source: If the language is not installed in the Windows image, the command will fail.
segment.target: If the language is not installed in the Windows image, the command will fail.

segment.source: language_name specifies the name of the language to set as the default; for example, ja-JP.
segment.target: language_name specifies the name of the language to set as the default; for example, ja-JP.

segment.source: If you install a Language Interface Pack (LIP) and specify its language as the default UI language, the LIP language will be set as the system default UI language (or Install language) and the parent language will be set as the default UI language.
segment.target: If you install a Language Interface Pack (LIP) and specify its language as the default UI language, the LIP language will be set as the system default UI language (or Install language) and the parent language will be set as the default UI language.

segment.source: Sets the fallback default language for the system UI in the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Sets the fallback default language for the system UI in the offline Windows image.

segment.source: This setting is used only when the language specified by the /Set-UILang option is a partially localized language.
segment.target: This setting is used only when the language specified by the /Set-UILang option is a partially localized language.

segment.source: language_name specifies the name of the language to set as the default fallback; for example, en-US.
segment.target: language_name specifies the name of the language to set as the default fallback; for example, en-US.

segment.source: Sets the language for non-Unicode programs (also called system locale) and font settings in the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Sets the language for non-Unicode programs (also called system locale) and font settings in the offline Windows image.

segment.source: locale_name specifies the name of the language and locale to set as the default language for non-Unicode; for example, en-US.
segment.target: locale_name specifies the name of the language and locale to set as the default language for non-Unicode; for example, en-US.

segment.source: You cannot set Unicode-only languages as the system locale.
segment.target: You cannot set Unicode-only languages as the system locale.

segment.source: If you try, the /Set-SysLocale option will fail and the language for non-Unicode programs will not be changed.
segment.target: If you try, the /Set-SysLocale option will fail and the language for non-Unicode programs will not be changed.

segment.source: Sets the standards and formats language (also called user locale) in the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Sets the standards and formats language (also called user locale) in the offline Windows image.

segment.source: The standards and formats language is a per-user setting that determines default sort order and the default settings for formatting dates, times, currency, and numbers.
segment.target: The standards and formats language is a per-user setting that determines default sort order and the default settings for formatting dates, times, currency, and numbers.

segment.source: Sets the input locales and keyboard layouts to use in the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Sets the input locales and keyboard layouts to use in the offline Windows image.

segment.source: The value of the input_locale:keyboard_layout pair can be one of the following:
segment.target: The value of the input_locale:keyboard_layout pair can be one of the following:

segment.source: For example, if you specify en-US as the local name, The Set-InputLocale: option also sets the default keyboard layout defined for this locale.
segment.target: For example, if you specify en-US as the local name, The Set-InputLocale: option also sets the default keyboard layout defined for this locale.

segment.source: You can specify more than one value by using semicolons as separators.
segment.target: You can specify more than one value by using semicolons as separators.

segment.source: This is useful when you want to include support for multiple keyboards on a single computer.
segment.target: This is useful when you want to include support for multiple keyboards on a single computer.

segment.source: The first value will be set as the default keyboard.
segment.target: The first value will be set as the default keyboard.

segment.source: The valid keyboard layouts that can be configured on your computer are listed in the following registry key.
segment.target: The valid keyboard layouts that can be configured on your computer are listed in the following registry key.

segment.source: For a list of the values, see Default Input Locales and Default Keyboard Settings.
segment.target: For a list of the values, see Default Input Locales and Default Keyboard Settings.

segment.source: Use the hexadecimal value of the language ID and keyboard layout that you intend to configure.
segment.target: Use the hexadecimal value of the language ID and keyboard layout that you intend to configure.

segment.source: Sets the default system UI language, the language for non-Unicode programs, the standards and formats language, and the input locales and keyboard layouts to the specified language in the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Sets the default system UI language, the language for non-Unicode programs, the standards and formats language, and the input locales and keyboard layouts to the specified language in the offline Windows image.

segment.source: This option specifies the language value for the following:
segment.target: This option specifies the language value for the following:

segment.source: If used with any of the options that specify the individual language or locales, then the individual settings take precedence.
segment.target: If used with any of the options that specify the individual language or locales, then the individual settings take precedence.

segment.source: language_name specifies the language name and locale code; for example, en-US, es-ES, or fr-FR.
segment.target: language_name specifies the language name and locale code; for example, en-US, es-ES, or fr-FR.

segment.source: Sets the default time zone in a Windows image.
segment.target: Sets the default time zone in a Windows image.

segment.source: Before setting the time zone, DISM verifies that the specified time zone string is valid for the image.
segment.target: Before setting the time zone, DISM verifies that the specified time zone string is valid for the image.

segment.source: timezone_name specifies the name of the time zone to use; for example, Pacific Standard Time.
segment.target: timezone_name specifies the name of the time zone to use; for example, Pacific Standard Time.

segment.source: For a complete list of time-zone strings, see the Windows® Unattended Setup Reference.
segment.target: For a complete list of time-zone strings, see the Windows® Unattended Setup Reference.

segment.source: On a computer that is running Windows 7, you can use the tzutil command-line tool to list the time zone for that computer.
segment.target: On a computer that is running Windows 7, you can use the tzutil command-line tool to list the time zone for that computer.

segment.source: The tzutil tool is installed by default on Windows 7.
segment.target: The tzutil tool is installed by default on Windows 7.

segment.source: The name of the time zone must exactly match the name of the time zone settings in the registry in HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\TimeZones\.
segment.target: The name of the time zone must exactly match the name of the time zone settings in the registry in HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\TimeZones\.

segment.source: If you add a custom time zone to your computer, you can specify that custom time-zone string.
segment.target: If you add a custom time zone to your computer, you can specify that custom time-zone string.

segment.source: Sets the default system UI language, the language for non-Unicode programs, the standards and formats language, and the input locales, keyboard layouts, and time zone values in an offline Windows image to the default value specified by language_name.
segment.target: Sets the default system UI language, the language for non-Unicode programs, the standards and formats language, and the input locales, keyboard layouts, and time zone values in an offline Windows image to the default value specified by language_name.

segment.source: The /Set-SKUIntlDefaults option does not change the keyboard driver for Japanese and Korean keyboards.
segment.target: The /Set-SKUIntlDefaults option does not change the keyboard driver for Japanese and Korean keyboards.

segment.source: You must use the /Set-LayeredDriver option to change this.
segment.target: You must use the /Set-LayeredDriver option to change this.

segment.source: Use / Set-SKUIntlDefaults to change all the international settings in an offline Windows image to match the default values that are set during retail installations.
segment.target: Use / Set-SKUIntlDefaults to change all the international settings in an offline Windows image to match the default values that are set during retail installations.

segment.source: For more information about the default values of each language pack, see Default Input Locales for Windows Language Packs.
segment.target: For more information about the default values of each language pack, see Default Input Locales for Windows Language Packs.

segment.source: If combined with one of the settings earlier in this section, the individual setting takes priority.
segment.target: If combined with one of the settings earlier in this section, the individual setting takes priority.

segment.source: If the language passed matches a Unicode-only locale setting, the system locale will not be changed but the command will not fail.
segment.target: If the language passed matches a Unicode-only locale setting, the system locale will not be changed but the command will not fail.

segment.source: Specifies a keyboard driver to use for Japanese or Korean keyboards.
segment.target: Specifies a keyboard driver to use for Japanese or Korean keyboards.

segment.source: In Japan, many retail users have 106-key keyboards, whereas others have 101- or 102-key keyboards.
segment.target: In Japan, many retail users have 106-key keyboards, whereas others have 101- or 102-key keyboards.

segment.source: In Korea, there are several different types of keyboards, some with different numbers of keys.
segment.target: In Korea, there are several different types of keyboards, some with different numbers of keys.

segment.source: The possible values for these settings are [1-6]:
segment.target: The possible values for these settings are [1-6]:

segment.source: Specifies the Korean PC/AT 101-Key Compatible Keyboard/MS Natural Keyboard (Type 1).
segment.target: Specifies the Korean PC/AT 101-Key Compatible Keyboard/MS Natural Keyboard (Type 1).

segment.source: Specifies the Korean PC/AT 101-Key Compatible Keyboard/MS Natural Keyboard (Type 2).
segment.target: Specifies the Korean PC/AT 101-Key Compatible Keyboard/MS Natural Keyboard (Type 2).

segment.source: Specifies the Korean PC/AT 101-Key Compatible Keyboard/MS Natural Keyboard (Type 3).
segment.target: Specifies the Korean PC/AT 101-Key Compatible Keyboard/MS Natural Keyboard (Type 3).

segment.source: Generates a new Lang.ini file, which is used by Setup to define the language packs inside the image and outside in the distribution.
segment.target: Generates a new Lang.ini file, which is used by Setup to define the language packs inside the image and outside in the distribution.

segment.source: It also defines the default UI language for Setup.
segment.target: It also defines the default UI language for Setup.

segment.source: The new Lang.ini file will be added to the Sources folder of the Windows distribution.
segment.target: The new Lang.ini file will be added to the Sources folder of the Windows distribution.

segment.source: You will not be prompted for permission to overwrite an existing Lang.ini file.
segment.target: You will not be prompted for permission to overwrite an existing Lang.ini file.

segment.source: The existing Lang.ini file will be overwritten automatically.
segment.target: The existing Lang.ini file will be overwritten automatically.

segment.source: You must specify an offline Windows image (/Image:path_to_offline_image.wim and a distribution (/Distribution:path_to_distribution_directory).
segment.target: You must specify an offline Windows image (/Image:path_to_offline_image.wim and a distribution (/Distribution:path_to_distribution_directory).

segment.source: Defines the default language that will be used by Setup.
segment.target: Defines the default language that will be used by Setup.

segment.source: If this language cannot be used, Setup automatically uses English.
segment.target: If this language cannot be used, Setup automatically uses English.

segment.source: If not used, the default UI language in the image will be used.
segment.target: If not used, the default UI language in the image will be used.

segment.source: If the language is not present, the first language in the list of present languages will be used.
segment.target: If the language is not present, the first language in the list of present languages will be used.

segment.source: Specifies the path to the Windows distribution.
segment.target: Specifies the path to the Windows distribution.

segment.source: The Windows distribution is a copy of the content that releases on the Windows product DVD.
segment.target: The Windows distribution is a copy of the content that releases on the Windows product DVD.

segment.source: This option is only for use with the /Get-Intl and /Gen-LangINI option if there are external language packs.
segment.target: This option is only for use with the /Get-Intl and /Gen-LangINI option if there are external language packs.

segment.source: The DISM International servicing commands cannot be used on a Windows Vista or a Windows Server 2008 image.
segment.target: The DISM International servicing commands cannot be used on a Windows Vista or a Windows Server 2008 image.

segment.source: For information about servicing Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008 images, see the Windows Vista SP1 release of the Windows OEM Preinstallation Kit (Windows OPK) or Windows Automated Installation Kit (Windows AIK).
segment.target: For information about servicing Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008 images, see the Windows Vista SP1 release of the Windows OEM Preinstallation Kit (Windows OPK) or Windows Automated Installation Kit (Windows AIK).

segment.source: You cannot use other servicing commands on the same command line with international servicing commands.
segment.target: You cannot use other servicing commands on the same command line with international servicing commands.

segment.source: You cannot set a Unicode-only language as the system locale.
segment.target: You cannot set a Unicode-only language as the system locale.

segment.source: The following languages are Unicode-only (Languages are listed in the table in the format: Language - Country/Region):
segment.target: The following languages are Unicode-only (Languages are listed in the table in the format: Language - Country/Region):

segment.source: Nepali - Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal
segment.target: Nepali - Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal

segment.source: Do not install a language pack after an update.
segment.target: Do not install a language pack after an update.

segment.source: If you install an update (hotfix, general distribution release GDR, or service pack SP) that contains language-dependent resources before you install a language pack, the language-specific changes contained in the update are not applied.
segment.target: If you install an update (hotfix, general distribution release GDR, or service pack SP) that contains language-dependent resources before you install a language pack, the language-specific changes contained in the update are not applied.

segment.source: Always install language packs before installing updates.
segment.target: Always install language packs before installing updates.

segment.source: When specifying a time zone by using /Set-TimeZone:timezonename you must use straight quotation marks for multiple words.
segment.target: When specifying a time zone by using /Set-TimeZone:timezonename you must use straight quotation marks for multiple words.

segment.source: If you copy and paste the time zone name, including quotation marks, from a Microsoft® Word document, the quotation marks might not be recognized and the command line might fail.
segment.target: If you copy and paste the time zone name, including quotation marks, from a Microsoft® Word document, the quotation marks might not be recognized and the command line might fail.

segment.source: If you are servicing an international image, and your host environment does not support the language in that image, you might not be able to read an error message that originates from the international image.
segment.target: If you are servicing an international image, and your host environment does not support the language in that image, you might not be able to read an error message that originates from the international image.

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options
